just back from the Chicago show and here's the personal 
prospective.......=
..
no Japanese dealers present due to the big holiday in Japan at the 
same=
 time, so next year the show may switch to a different date.  
Just specula=
tion , ok ?

Personally I did a lot of buy/sell/trade............
as usual =
Walberg brought along his boxes of goodies and emptied my 
wallet. Among th=
e new toys I bought from the Big Guy is a signed Goto 
school single fuchi =
with a peacock motif which matches exactly my 
other mumei fuchi...so now I=
 am quite positive the other unsigned 
piece is of the Goto school.

Did se=
e a few " big money " changed hands so there's some " actions " 
going on t=
here .

As usual Jim gave an excellent presentation/discussion  on what mak=
e 
a good tsuba.  I,  being my usual self with the big mouth , actually 
ha=
s the audacity to say a tsuba " turned me off "......with 
strange/interest=
ing result !!  Jim did mention there's no right or 
wrong answer regarding =
the tsuba so i figure why not......

Benson's tsuba price is very very reas=
onable at the show but too bad 
I dropped all my $ at Hagrid's.

The best p=
art of the show is still touching bases with old friends, 
telling the same=
 ole stale jokes and seeing everyone is still alive 
and kicking........
Pe=
rfect weather throughout and to cap the day, i get to spot the 
resident re=
d tail hawk's nest and see the magificient bird flying and 
doing well.
For=
 more detail and insightful report............ that you have to 
wait till =
Barry gets home.

Milt
